description: Supply a set of continuous bathymetric and cross-section surveys between lower Peace River and upper Slave River in Wood Buffalo National Park
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Title (English and French)

- **Eng:** Bathymetric and Cross-section Surveys of Peace River and Slave River – Wood Buffalo National Park
- **Fra:** Relevés bathymétriques et transversaux de la rivière de la Paix et de la rivière des Esclaves – Parc national Wood Buffalo

## Tender Details

- **Reference Number:** cb-585-86311308
- **Solicitation Number:** 5P420-23-0404/A
- **Publication Date:** 2024-05-14
- **Tender Closing Date:** 2024-06-20T16:00:00
- **Expected Contract Start Date:** 2024-06-21
- **Expected Contract End Date:** 2026-03-31

## Procurement Information

- **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
- **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
- **Trade Agreements:** Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, and others

## Bidding Requirements

- **Submission Deadline:** 2024-06-20T16:00:00
- **Acceptable Bidding Methods:** Electronic submission via fax, email (to **soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca**), or regular mail. While SAP Ariba is not currently accepted, all other formats are recognized.
- **Email File Size Limitation:** 15 megabytes; each bidder must consider overall email size, as some attachments may be resized during transmission.
- **Documentation Requirements:** Send bid documents as email attachments; electronic links are not accepted.
- **Security Measures:** Upon submission, bid information becomes the property of Parks Canada.

## Work Requirements

- **Contract:** Period of contract extends from contract signing to 31 March 2025; with the bargaining option to extend the contract by one additional year (1 April 2025 to 31 March 2026).
- **Bathymetric Surveys:** Requirements call for continuous surveys between lower Peace River and upper Slave River in Wood Buffalo National Park.
- **Cross-section Surveys:** Participate in project meetings to aid in the successful conclusion of the task.

## Inquiries

- **Contact Person:** Daniel Nguyen (daniel.nguyen@pc.gc.ca; (403) 836-2352)
- **Tender documents:** Obtain documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service through
